evidence.text: "A trial court may, with propriety, find it is efficient for its own docket and the fairest course for the parties to enter a stay of an action before it, pending resolution of independent proceedings which bear upon the case."

extracted.value: Trial court may, with propriety, find it is efficient for its own docket and the fairest course for the parties to enter a stay of an action before it, pending resolution of independent proceedings which bear upon the case.

evidence.text: "To do otherwise would be tantamount to having one trial court sit as an appellate court, reviewing the decision of another trial court."

extracted.value: To do otherwise would be tantamount to having one trial court sit as an appellate court, reviewing the decision of another trial court.
